block.p: Re ''Danger: Playground Ahead,'' by Allison Arieff (Op-Ed, May 29):
Re ''Danger: Playground Ahead,'' by Allison Arieff (Op-Ed, May 29):
While it is all well and good to capture the interest of adolescents, a playground safety expert should be added to your team of artists, architects and designers, to provide a new playground design.

As an attorney who has been involved in playground design cases, including a horrible accident where a 7-year-old boy was rendered a quadriplegic in a New York City playground, I can remind you that safety needs should come first and that the playgrounds are used by kids of all ages.
Tempting a younger child, or even an adolescent, to take an unnecessary risk that may have lifelong negative and perhaps even catastrophic consequences should be avoided.

Playground safety, like car safety, has developed over time. When car manufacturers wax nostalgic, they still incorporate the newest safety ideas into their retro vehicles. You should do the same in your new playgrounds.
Tomas L. Bondy New York, May 29, 2007
